meanings.definition: To send away from a place as a punishment or to force someone to leave
meanings.sent1: The king decided to banish the troublemaker from the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The judge may choose to banish a criminal to a faraway island.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf was banished from the enchanted forest for playing pranks on the fairies.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the evil sorcerer cast a spell to banish the hero to a realm of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The teacher threatened to banish the noisy student to the hallway if he didn't quiet down.

meanings.definition: To get rid of something unwanted or unpleasant
meanings.sent1: I need to banish these old clothes from my closet to make space for new ones.
meanings.sent2: Using a good cleaning product can help banish stubborn stains from the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The brave knight set out on a quest to banish the dragon terrorizing the village.
meanings.sent4: The bright sunlight helped banish the shadows lurking in the corners of the room.
meanings.sent5: A positive attitude can banish negative thoughts from your mind.

meanings.definition: To exile or expel someone from a community or group
meanings.sent1: The strict rules of the club may lead to a decision to banish members who break them.
meanings.sent2: The tribe's tradition was to banish those who betrayed their trust.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was banished from the treehouse for stealing nuts from the others.
meanings.sent4: The powerful wizard had the ability to banish enemies with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent5: The council voted to banish the troublemaker to the outskirts of the village.
